website_summaries.verdict: When you’re seeking a ball that spins less than others, especially on long iron shots, this is the best Titleist ball.
pros: Seems to cut through strong winds better than other types of balls
Creates a high level of ball speed off the club face
Delivers plenty of distance off the tee or out of the fairway, as the ball stays on track with a true ball flight
cons: Not as useful for players who tend to hit the ball higher in the air

customer_reviews.title: Lower trajectory, softer.
customer_reviews.text: Found a new Titleist AVX ball on the course and loved the performance. Lower trajectory and softer ball for my slowing club-head speed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda 1

customer_reviews.title: Took a little while to get used to but it is a nice ball
customer_reviews.text: I typically play Velocity or NXT Tour S. I'm a 10.3 handicap. I expected the AVX to feel like ProV1's but it didn't. Felt a bit plastic and not as soft as the ProV1 or even NXT Tour S. I purchased for a trip to Ireland/Scotland to reduce ball hight in the wind. I couldn't notice any discernible reduction in the height of my shots. That being said I did hit them straight and my putting was very solid on quick greens. A bit overpriced at $50 a dozen. Will probably stick to velocity and prior gen NXT Tour for the time being but all in all a quality golf ball.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle yablonsky

customer_reviews.title: Great ball!
customer_reviews.text: Gave these a try in place of ProV1. Not too excited that they are the same price. However, I noticed greater spin into the greens with my irons and the balls are very durable. After my first round, I used the same ball the whole round and it doesn't have a scratch on it. They are more durable than ProV1 in my opinion but not as soft.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Titlest AVX Comparable to the Taylormade TP5x
customer_reviews.text: I like the durability of the ball and the feel and spun on the greens, but the distance off the tee, fairway woods and irons was not as far as the ProV1. I found it similar to TaylorMade's TP5x. Spin on longer wedge shots 70 to 90 yards was good, but no better than ProV1 at distances 20 yards or shorter.
customer_reviews.author: Blade Putter

customer_reviews.title: Longer
customer_reviews.text: This ball has replaced my ProV1s. It's longer and has the same or better feel around the green with no noticeable difference on the green. I started playing in a Senior league this summer and decided to try a sleeve back in July. The difference is definitely noticeable. An extra 10+ yards off the tee, same great feel around the green as the ProV but less spin has to be taken in to account. Not much spin back for me but you can certainly stop them. Now my go to ball. I'm 63, 24 handicap, and an 85mph swing speed for reference. (Handicap is coming down btw :-) )
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Longer maybe, but not a pro v1x
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps a bit longer than prov1x but not as consistent around the greens. They are seriously over priced. Sadly, because i had read these would come down in price after initial release. Pro v1x is still my go to ball.
customer_reviews.author: bproper

customer_reviews.title: Best ball I've ever played
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these after reading the other reviews. Thought I would chime in and say I agree with this being one of the best. It definitely goes farther than the prov1 and seems softer. Not sure how they did it. First round I played it was going about 10 yards further and on a couple of chip shots the ball checked up. I was very impressed all around. I do agree that the price is high and when I lost one I think I searched way longer then I should have. The only downside besides the price is the ball is not durable. At the end of 18 holes the cover was cut in a couple of spots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great golf ball!
customer_reviews.text: I am very picky when it comes to golf balls. I generally play the Bridgestone B330 RX, but read about these in Golf Magazine and wanted to try them. I really love these. I am not a fan of Pro V's of any type. For whatever reason they just do not fit my game, but I am a big fan of these. I love the slightly lower ball flight while maintaining good control around the greens. The only down side is that they are spendy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Parsons

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT BALL
customer_reviews.text: For all you true duffers out there, this is the ball for you. I have hit Bridgestone balls for sometime. As my handicap rose I continued to use them. I decided to try this new ball WHAT A DIFFERENCE!!! Since I started striking this ball I went from shooting in the high 50’s to shooting in this low to mid 40’s. I am 7-1-1 in league competition since changing to the new ball. Prior to this I had not won a round This is a great ball
customer_reviews.author: BigJem

customer_reviews.title: Quality ball, but not for my game.
customer_reviews.text: Another quality Titleist ball, was not getting the same distance out of this ball as I do from my Snell MTBX gamer off the tee. Differences were negligible on iron shots and around the greens. It is a nice ball but when price and performance are factored in, this ball could not beat out my Snell ball...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Distance ball and soft
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally soft feel. Longer on my driver and irons. Wedge shots Onto green land soft and stop. 17 Handicap purchased again. Replaces my Prov 1x
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D Kellar

customer_reviews.title: Better than the best!
customer_reviews.text: Great off the tee, supreme feel and response! Recommend to all golfers!
customer_reviews.author: David Murphy Jr

customer_reviews.title: Love these Balls
customer_reviews.text: I was hitting the ProV1 and a friend let me hit his Titleist AVX balls and man was I shocked. For my game, this balls flies like crazy and it stops on a dime around the green. To me, it checks up better than the ProV1. Just my opinion. Love these balls.
customer_reviews.author: Will Craver

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hate them; didn't love them - not right for me.
customer_reviews.text: They were not right for me. Too soft but nice spin and durable - trees and cart paths did not seem to scuff them much.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Craig Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best Golf Balls
customer_reviews.text: “These are the best golf balls around, and I’ve used them all.” -My Dad
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Good and Long
customer_reviews.text: I really can't tell the difference between these balls and pro v's around the green. I get just as must spin and check on the ball which I love. The difference is that I seem to get more distance off the tee.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Page

customer_reviews.title: MEh - stick with Pro-V1
customer_reviews.text: Being on the taller side I tend to have a high ball flight. I normally hit V1's and was wanting to really like this ball but the feeling was lackluster and it didn't overcome flight trajectory.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Über soft, long
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those with high clubhead speed and need to lower long-game spin. This ball has a lower more penetrating flight than ProV1x and wayyyy softer. Feels like butter off of my 716CB irons. Even longer now.
customer_reviews.author: Matt F

customer_reviews.title: Another nice addition to a fine golf ball line.
customer_reviews.text: Still on the fence as-to whether or not they are better than the V1 but they felt fine in play.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best golf ball on the market
customer_reviews.text: As a scratch golfer this is the first ball I have ever hit and I knew was instantly longer. Great feel as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would try these out as I usually use the ProV1 and found out that I did get more distance and less spin.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Great balls of fire
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put a fade or draw with these balls. Soft feel.
customer_reviews.author: Richard klinger

customer_reviews.title: Great new ball by Titleist
customer_reviews.text: Lower spin on long irons and woods. Bores through the wind. I think it's just a touch softer then the Pro V1, and half a club longer.
customer_reviews.author: VeroBchBum

customer_reviews.title: Low spin, flies straight
customer_reviews.text: Mid-handicapper here. This is the lowest spinning ball I have ever hit. It does an excellent job of maintaining it's flight direction off the tee.
customer_reviews.author: Entreri

customer_reviews.title: Nice balls
customer_reviews.text: Gave these as a gift to a young man who loves to golf. He said they are really nice golf balls and he wouldn't normally be able to afford them.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Go to ball
customer_reviews.text: Best ball in the game. Great lower compression ball for those who want more distance and forgiveness that the proV doesn’t provide on longer shots. More forgiving without loosing performance around greens.
customer_reviews.author: Tom munday

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my cousin as a gift. This is what he wanted. They can be expensive but I got them on Amazon on sale, so it was worth it. He was happy to receive them!
customer_reviews.author: JRS

customer_reviews.title: Best Ball Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This ball delivers distance, control and best feel, better than Pro V1 and Pro V1X.
customer_reviews.author: Planman

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: do Not buy anything from this company. Very very poor quality merchandise. Poor return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good ball
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I like the performance characteristics of this ball compared to the Pro V1 or Pro V1X.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Best. Ball. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I really think this is the best and most durable ball out there. I try not to lose too many because they are coveted. Actually makes me focus more because I hate to lose them!
customer_reviews.author: Electronics buff

customer_reviews.title: Titleist AVX Golf Balls
customer_reviews.text: Great ball, "a little pricey", but you get what you pay for. This ball has lowered my scores!!
customer_reviews.author: SAMUEL COATS

customer_reviews.title: Son loves them
customer_reviews.text: I know every golfer plays with a different ball. My son was hitting a softer ball, went to the ProV1x and it really threw off his game. This one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: but it is a better ball for me than the
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but it is a better ball for me than the ProV
customer_reviews.author: Peter R. Duke

customer_reviews.title: Ripped Off
customer_reviews.text: This is just a straight rip off. I opened my and a sleeve of the AVX where replaced with a sleeve of DT Tru Soft balls... the box was sealed and tap shut so you know someone did that on purpose. This box of balls isn’t cheap and this is what I get! Don’t trust these people with your money..
customer_reviews.author: Michael Esposito

customer_reviews.title: nice ball for my skill level
customer_reviews.text: this ball seems like the Kirkland tour performance. I have not cut one open, but it seems similar.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Gift for our son. Golfers can never have too many golf balls.
customer_reviews.author: Jack in TX

customer_reviews.title: The item is as advertised. However delivery was worse than lousey!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the golf ball for my husband. He is very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: vicki l maddux

customer_reviews.title: Great golf ball
customer_reviews.text: Titleist balls are the best. Not quite as nice as Pro V1 or Pro V1x
customer_reviews.author: Bowhunter-1

customer_reviews.title: Longer & Straighter
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is the real deal. I have always played ProV1 or X. I have tried other balls seeking more distance but they feel like rocks. First drive I hit was dead straight and they all are that way. Probably 10 yds longer most of the time. You can tell it spins less than the X but it is soft enough around the greens to play well. Long irons are longer and straighter as well.
customer_reviews.author: KennyV

customer_reviews.title: Long and straight
customer_reviews.text: This is now my favorite Titleist golf ball. Might not have as much spin as the Pro V but its longer and straighter
customer_reviews.author: Jeesee

customer_reviews.title: Titlelist does it again.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and you can’t go wrong with Titlelist. I’m a 11 handicap. There may be too many options for my skill group.
customer_reviews.author: professor_ctt

customer_reviews.title: What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: The delivery was prompt and product was what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Hernan

customer_reviews.title: Luv this ball!
customer_reviews.text: Best ball this old mid handicapper ever played. Great feel and very long.
customer_reviews.author: Sean D. Leahy

customer_reviews.title: Long and straight
customer_reviews.text: This ball was long and the wind had less effect in it.
customer_reviews.author: David Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Best golf ball out there
customer_reviews.text: Best ball on the market in my opinion. Softer feel than Pro V1 and slightly flatter trajectory (I am a high ball hitter, so this appeals to me).
customer_reviews.author: John T Steinbrunner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: One of the best balls I've played, super long with great feel around the greens
customer_reviews.author: Mike Raczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on these for the price. Just more expensive NXT's.
customer_reviews.author: William Mitchell Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball Especially in Windy Conditions
customer_reviews.text: Used these in HHI in some windy conditions and felt like they penetrated the wind extraordinarily well.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Roth

customer_reviews.title: Love this ball - goes far, nice action around the green
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 4th box of these = love them.
customer_reviews.author: N. Geltz

customer_reviews.title: Pro V1 far superior.
customer_reviews.text: Lost distance in driving. Not worth the money. ProV1’s still a much ball. 10 handicap
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: super ball. Long
customer_reviews.text: found a replacement for my Pro V-1X. super ball. Long, soft feel and great off the putter. shot best score in years with first use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Straight ball!
customer_reviews.text: This ball is straight and great but ok around the green. I would recommend for any low to mid handicapped golfer who is tall and generates more spin.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Kade

customer_reviews.title: Play Your Best
customer_reviews.text: Swing speed over 105 and I get the most distance out of these AVX’s then Bridgestone and ProV1’s. Nice around greens also. Good durability. Yellow ones have a sparkle to them thats kinda coo and doesn’t look weird.
customer_reviews.author: Mright

customer_reviews.title: BEST ball to golf with
customer_reviews.text: This is the only ball my son uses, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: This ball has exceptional distance with a soft feel around ...
customer_reviews.text: This ball has exceptional distance with a soft feel around the greens. This is taking over as the ball of choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: clarence

customer_reviews.title: It’s my favorite golf ball now
customer_reviews.text: It’s my favorite golf ball now. Very soft if that’s what you’re looking for. Feels great off the putter. Good distance.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Low spin off tee, soft feel on approach and off putter
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J Farnum

customer_reviews.title: It's a Titleist!
customer_reviews.text: nice Titleist quality - good ball and a little less than Pro V 1
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Love AVX
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing the new Titleist AVX golf ball for several months. Love IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sims

customer_reviews.title: Titleist AVX is not worth what it costs
customer_reviews.text: It is a new ball from Titleist and it is just OK. Distance less than Pro V.
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer Mike

customer_reviews.title: These are a Must buy for high ball flight players
customer_reviews.text: This ball keeps a low ball flight and has less spin to help control miss hits off the Tee.. This ball also has excellent feel around the greens.
customer_reviews.author: Neil hone

customer_reviews.title: Good balls
customer_reviews.text: Every time I hit the balls I sliced. Might not be the balls. Definitely not the balls fault, I just suck.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ed

customer_reviews.title: Best Titleist ball I've played
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single digit and just switched to this AVX instead of the ProV1. Amazing ball control and more spin.
customer_reviews.author: D. Scott Friend

customer_reviews.title: Not as good on approaches & the greens as
customer_reviews.text: 10 yards farther! Not as good on approaches & the greens as ProV1
customer_reviews.author: Rob K. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best golf ball available
customer_reviews.text: Best golf ball available, drives great, chips and putts great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice balls
customer_reviews.text: Good performing balls to the new titleist line up comparable to pro v
customer_reviews.author: Golf maniac

customer_reviews.title: Love the yellow ones
customer_reviews.text: These are now my go-to golf ball. Love the yellow ones, too.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Brown

customer_reviews.title: Watch the small box description. Didn't see yellow, thought they would be white.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice color on box because the print was very small.
customer_reviews.author: Russ in Savannah, Ga.

customer_reviews.title: Great feel & Distance
customer_reviews.text: Great feel and distance. At least as long as my ProV1-
customer_reviews.author: C William Stuck

customer_reviews.title: The ball is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Love the ball does seem to add distance as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Card

customer_reviews.title: A LITTLE LONGER BUT............
customer_reviews.text: These ball are longer for me than the proV. Especially with the irons. The down side is they don’t hold the green as well. But overall I like the ball.
customer_reviews.author: LURP

customer_reviews.title: It’s a golf ball
customer_reviews.text: These have a nice feel to them. They still find the trees and the water. When is someone going to make a ball that stays away from lakes and trees?
customer_reviews.author: Jeepster

customer_reviews.title: Did not like them a little bit
customer_reviews.text: These balls feel like I’m hitting rocks. I’m getting NO distance. Why is this? No clue. I’m going back to pro v1x. I get more distance from range balls. Very weird
customer_reviews.author: paul j boyd

customer_reviews.title: Too little spin
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these balls. I have played several rounds with them now, and they seem to go the same distance as other premium balls, including the ProV1 and ProV1x off the tee. I do think I hit my short irons a little further, but that is not a good thing. On approach shots, they just don't spin quite enough to give the stopping power I have come to expect, and chips will really roll out. The cover seems incredibly durable. I played 36 holes with a single ball, and it was still in good shape. I can see why some would like the ball, but I am going back to Titleist ProV line.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Danker

customer_reviews.title: Bright YELLOW Ball.  Long off the driver and Softer feeling with the putter than similar pro balls.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and consistent playing golf ball. Softer feeling than the Pro V1x and just as long off the driver as the Pro V1. Yellow color is great. Not as bright as a Chromax or Matte finish golf balls but much easier to see than other Yellow multi-piece golf balls.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the ProV1 and ProV1 X... these ...
customer_reviews.text: Prefer the ProV1 and ProV1 X... these balls are not nearly as soft around the greens. I would fly a wedge in pin high, and the ball would release over the green or I end up putting outside 15-20 feet Stick with ProV1
customer_reviews.author: Neal

product_meta.title: Titleist AVX Golf Balls (One Dozen)
feature_bullets: Very Low Long Game and Iron Spin

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
